item.title: Learning python: My Sudoku game - Pydoku
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description: This post is an overview of the Sudoku game and Sudoku solver algorithm visualization that I implemented in Python 3.

item.title: Apache Maven Part 3 - Inheritance, aggregation and multi-module projects
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description:
This multi-post series is looking at Apache Maven.
In this third part, we will have a look at inheritance and aggregation in Maven and how everything comes together to form multi-module Maven projects.

item.title: Apache Maven Part 2 - Build lifecycle and Apache Maven Plugins
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description: This multi-post series is looking at Apache Maven. In the second part, we will take a closer look at the build lifecycle and the workers in Maven - Maven Plugins.

item.title: Apache Maven Part 1 - Introduction and basics
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description: This multi-post series will be looking at Apache Maven. In this first part, we will provide a high-level overview, explain some of the basics and show an example of a simple Maven managed project.

item.title: Classloaders in Java
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description:
In this post, we will be looking at a very important part of the
Java Runtime Environment (or JRE) - Class loaders.

We will look at what they are, how they work and how we can implement our own custom class loader.

item.title: Java Archive file - JAR
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description:
In this post, we will have a closer look at one of the basic building blocks in the Java ecosystem - the Java ARchive or as it is more known, the JAR file.
We will describe what it is and how to create one.

item.title: Reflection in Java
item.author: matija@devflection.com (Matija Heričko)
item.description:
Reflection is the ability of an application to inspect and modify the code in the system.

If an application can only inspect but not also modify the code then it only has the ability of introspection.

So for an application to be reflective it must also be able to modify its code at runtime.
